Method Detail

defineBlob

public Myro.MyroBlobSpec defineBlob(int xlow,
                                    int ylow,
                                    int width,
                                    int height)
Calculate a blob based on a rectangular area of the image. The specified rectangle must be non-empty and be conpletely within the image. The returned blob contains the average color of the rectangular area of the image and can be passed to the scribbler's configureBlob method.

Precondition: (xlow,ylow) is the coordinate of the upperleft corner or a rectangle within the image (i.e., >=0), width and height are both > 0, and the lowerright corner of the rectangle is within the image.

Returns:
A blob that can be passed to a scribbler configureBlob method.

get

public abstract java.awt.Color get(int x,
                                   int y)
Returns the RGB color of pixel (x,y).

Precondition: (x,y) is the coordinate of a pixel in the image.

Parameters:
x - x xoordinate of the pixel
y - y coordinate of the pixel
Returns:
The color of pixel (x,y)

getGray

public abstract int getGray(int x,
                            int y)
Returns the grayscale value of pixel (x,y).

Precondition: (x,y) is the coordinate of a pixel in the image.

Parameters:
x - x xoordinate of the pixel
y - y coordinate of the pixel
Returns:
The grayscale value of pixel (x,y), in the range 0..255

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type (i.e., Color or Grayscale) of this image.

Returns:
Value MYRO_IMAGE_COLOR or MYRO_IMAGE_GRAY.

getUserDefinedBlob

public Myro.MyroBlobSpec getUserDefinedBlob()
Allows the user to select a rectangular area of the image used to define a blob. The image is first made visible, then a message at the bottom of the window instructs the user to drag an area to define a blob. The blob returned contains the average color of the selected area and can be passed to the scribbler configureBlob method.

Returns:
null if the user selected a zero-size rectangle; otherwise a blob that can be passed to a scribbler configureBlob method.

height

public int height()
Returns the height of the image.

hide

public void hide()
Causes this image to be invisible (i.e., the window disappears from the screen). If this image was already invisible, no changes are made to any window.

lum

protected double lum(java.awt.Color color)
Returns the luminosity of an RGB color.

repaint

public void repaint()
Changes made to the image (e.g., by calling set) are reflected in the displayed window. If the window is invisible no changes are made to any window.

save

public void save(java.lang.String filename)
Save the image to a file. The only supported formats are jpg and png.

Precondition: filename must have an extension of .jpg or .png

Parameters:
filename - Name of the file to save the image to.

set

public abstract void set(int x,
                         int y,
                         java.awt.Color color)
Sets the color of pixel (x,y) to an RGB color. Changes will not appear on the screen until either show or repaint is called.

Precondition: (x,y) is the coordinate of a pixel in the image, color is not null.

Parameters:
x - x xoordinate of the pixel
y - y coordinate of the pixel
color - An RGB Color that pixel (x,y) is set to.

setGray

public abstract void setGray(int x,
                             int y,
                             int grayLevel)
Sets the color of pixel (x,y) to a grayscale color.

Precondition: (x,y) is the coordinate of a pixel in the image, grayLevel is between 0 (inclusive) and 255 (inclusive). Changes will not appear on the screen until either show or repaint is called.

Parameters:
x - x xoordinate of the pixel
y - y coordinate of the pixel
grayLevel - A grayscale value between 0 and 255 that pixel (x,y) is set to.

setImage

public void setImage(MyroImage newImage)
Changes this image to be a copy of the one passed as a parameter. If the image is visible, then the image is redisplayed to reflect the new image.

show

public void show()
Causes this image to be visible in a window. If the image had not been displayed previously a window will be created at the upperleft corner of the screen.

show

public void show(int x,
                 int y)
Causes this image to be visible in a window located at a specified location on the screen. The parameters specify the location of the upperleft corner of the window.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate of the upperleft corner of the window
y - y coordinate of the upperleft corner of the window

toGray

protected java.awt.Color toGray(java.awt.Color color)
Returns a grayscale color of an RGB color.

width

public int width()
Returns the width of the image.
